guicomponents
Class GComponent

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.GComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
GConstants, java.lang.Comparable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GActivityBar, GButton, GCheckbox, GCombo, GImageButton, GLabel, GOption, GPanel, GSlider, GTextField
public abstract class GComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements GConstants, java.lang.Comparable

CLASS FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY Abstract base class for all GUI components

Author:
Peter Lager

Constructor Detail

GComponent

public GComponent(PApplet theApplet,
                  int x,
                  int y)
INTERNAL USE ONLY This constructor MUST be called by all constructors of any child class e.g. GPanel, GLabel etc. Each component registers itself with G4P, the first component register the mainWinApp for later use. Only create the GScheme the first time it is called.

Parameters:
theApplet -
x -
y -
Method Detail

addEventHandler

public void addEventHandler(java.lang.Object obj,
                            java.lang.String methodName)
Attempt to create the default event handler for the component class. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has a single parameter of the same type as the component class generating the event and a method name specific for that class.

Parameters:
obj - the object to handle the event
methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class

addEventHandler

public void addEventHandler(java.lang.Object obj,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.Class[] parameters)
Attempt to create the default event handler for the component class. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has a single parameter of the same type as the componment class generating the event and a method name specific for that class.

Parameters:
obj - the object to handle the event
methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class
parameters - the parameter classes.

getEventType

public int getEventType()
This can be used to detect the type of event

Returns:
the eventType

add

public boolean add(GComponent component)
Add a GUI component to this GComponent at the position specified by component being added. If transparency has been applied to this GComponent then the same level will be applied to the component to be added. Unregister the component for drawing this is managed by the GComponent draw method to preserve z-ordering

Returns:
always true

remove

public void remove(GComponent component)
Remove a GUI component from this component

Parameters:
component -

mouseEvent

public void mouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
Override in child classes. Every object will execute this method when an event is to be processed.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent event)
Override in child classes

Parameters:
event -

changeWindow

public void changeWindow(PApplet newWindowApp)
Called when we add a component to another window. Transfers autos to new window for this component and all it's children.

Parameters:
newWindowApp -

isOver

public boolean isOver(int ax,
                      int ay)
Determines whether the position ax, ay is over this component. This is the default implementation and assumes the component is a rectangle where x & y is the top-left corner and the size is defined by width and height. Override this method where necessary in child classes e.g. GPanel

Parameters:
ax - mouse x position
ay - mouse y position
Returns:
true if mouse is over the component else false

calcAbsPosition

public void calcAbsPosition(java.awt.Point d)
This method will calculate the absolute top left position of this component taking into account any ancestors.

Parameters:
d -

text - use this function to set the text so that the text length is calculated

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text,
                    int align)
Parameters:
text - the text to set with alignment

setTextAlign

public void setTextAlign(int align)
Set the text alignment inside the box.
Horizontal must be one of the following GAlign.LEFT or GAlign.CENTER or GAlign.RIGHT
Vertical must be one of the following GAlign.TOP or GAlign.MIDDLE or GAlign.BOTTOM
Both horizontal and vertical allignment can be set in one call using bitwise OR e.g. GAlign.BOTTOM | GAlign.CENTER

Parameters:
align - the allignment flag

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enable)
Enable or disable the ability of the component to generate mouse events.
This will also disable key press events in GTextField

Parameters:
enable - true to enable else false

setBorder

public void setBorder(int border)
The user can add a border by specifying it's thickness a value of 0 means no border (this is the default)

Parameters:
border - width in pixels
